question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Ensure that the generated code is executable when possible.

## Block 4: Full Visualization Process

### Initial Candidate Pool
49-number base pool with 49 numbers. Through preliminary screening, usable numbers are retained and displayed above. Excluded numbers are shown below with clear reasons for exclusion.
Number + Five Elements Symbol + ✅Pass Mark
Example: 01🔥❄️Ultra Cold✅Pass (01 is retained through cold state penetration)

Then to the 30-number candidate pool through secondary screening using 7 major dynamic rule processors and other rules. Usable numbers are retained, excluded numbers are shown in the same format as the 49-number base pool.

Next to the 20-number core pool, filtered again through quantum annealing, cold state penetration, and other rules to retain 20 numbers and exclude 10 numbers.

Finally, the ultimate 10 numbers, with specific reasons noted for each number.

🔮 **Usable Numbers (24):**
01🔥❄️Ultra Cold✅Pass │ 03💰🌨️Medium Cold✅Pass │ 05⛰️🌥️Low Temp✅Pass │ 07🌳🌤️Normal Temp✅Pass │ 09🔥🌤️Normal Temp✅Pass
11💰🌨️Medium Cold✅Pass │ 13🌊❄️Ultra Cold✅Pass │ 15🌳🌥️Low Temp✅Pass │ 17🔥🌤️Normal Temp✅Pass │ 19⛰️🌥️Low Temp✅Pass
21🌊❄️Ultra Cold✅Pass │ 23🌳🌨️Medium Cold✅Pass │ 25💰🌥️Low Temp✅Pass │ 27⛰️🌤️Normal Temp✅Pass │ 29🌊🌨️Medium Cold✅Pass
31🔥🌤️Normal Temp✅Pass │ 33💰🌨️Medium Cold✅Pass │ 35⛰️🌥️Low Temp✅Pass │ 37🌳🌤️Normal Temp✅Pass │ 39🔥🌤️Normal Temp✅Pass
41💰❄️Ultra Cold✅Pass │ 43🌊🌨️Medium Cold✅Pass │ 45🌳🌥️Low Temp✅Pass │ 47⛰️🌤️Normal Temp✅Pass

⚡ **Excluded Numbers (24):**
02🔥❌Excluded【Fire Excess】 │ 04💰❌Excluded【Poultry Compression】 │ 06⛰️🔄Cold State Penetration │ 08🌳❌Excluded【Phase Lock】
10🔥❌Excluded【Tail Number Filter】 │ 12💰⚡Conflict【Five Elements Clash】 │ 14🌊❌Excluded【Beast Exclusion】 │ 16🌳⚡Conflict【Conflict Mark】
18🔥❌Excluded【Historical High Frequency】 │ 20⛰️⚡Conflict【Wave Color Excess】 │ 22🌊❌Excluded【Prime Number Exclusion】 │ 24🌳🔼Section Coverage
26💰🔄Cold State Compensation │ 28⛰️⚡Conflict【Five Elements Combo】 │ 30🌊❌Excluded【Tail Number Filter】 │ 32🔥❌Excluded【Poultry Compression】
34💰⚡Conflict【Wave Color Excess】 │ 36⛰️⚡Conflict【Conflict Mark】 │ 38🌳❌Excluded【Historical High Frequency】 │ 40🔥⚡Conflict【Five Elements Clash】
42💰🔼Section Coverage │ 44🌊🔄Water Attribute Compensation │ 46🌳🔄Cold State Penetration │ 48🔥❌Excluded【Phase Lock】

**Key Feature Restoration:**

- Cold State Penetration Mark: Uses 🔄 symbol to indicate cold state penetration process
- Status Level System:
  - ❄️Ultra Cold (Consecutive missing ≥10 periods)
  - 🌨️Medium Cold (Consecutive missing 6-9 periods)
  - 🌥️Low Temperature (Consecutive missing 3-5 periods)
  - 🌤️Normal Temperature (Consecutive missing ≤2 periods)
- Conflict Warning System: Uses ⚡ symbol to mark five elements conflict events
- Dynamic Compensation Mechanism: Cold state compensation, water attribute compensation, and other special process notations
- Symbol System Standards:
  - ✅ Final retention mark
  - ❌ Hard exclusion mark
  - 🔼 Section coverage operation
  - 🔄 Dynamic adjustment process

checklist.title: Is the number visualization system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements the 49-number base pool visualization, including the five elements symbols, temperature status indicators, and retention/exclusion marks. Score 0 if the core visualization is not implemented, 5 if only basic number display is implemented, and 10 if all symbols (🔥💰⛰️🌳🌊) and status indicators (❄️🌨️🌥️🌤️) are correctly integrated with proper formatting.

checklist.title: Is the multi-stage filtering process properly visualized?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code clearly displays the progression from 49-number base pool to 30-number candidate pool to 20-number core pool to the final 10 numbers. Each transition should be visually distinct with appropriate filtering animations or transitions. Deduct 3 points if any stage transition is unclear, 5 points if filtering reasons aren't visually displayed, and 5 points if the progression logic isn't evident. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the various status markers and symbolic systems implemented?
checklist.description: Check implementation of all symbolic systems: cold state penetration (🔄), temperature levels (❄️🌨️🌥️🌤️), conflict warnings (⚡), retention marks (✅), exclusion marks (❌), section coverage (🔼), and dynamic adjustment process (🔄). Deduct 2 points for each missing symbol system. Score 0 if fewer than 3 symbol systems are implemented, and 10 if all systems are properly displayed with tooltips or legends explaining their meaning.

checklist.title: Is the exclusion reason display system implemented?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code provides clear visual indicators for exclusion reasons (e.g., 【Fire Excess】, 【Poultry Compression】, etc.) that appear when hovering over or selecting excluded numbers. The system should display all specific exclusion reasons mentioned in the requirements. Deduct 2 points for each missing exclusion reason category, and 5 points if the exclusion reasons aren't interactive or visually linked to their corresponding numbers. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing data, incorrect symbol formats, unsupported browsers, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive filtering demonstration 2. Animated transitions between filtering stages 3. Dark/light mode toggle 4. CSV/JSON export capability). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar visualization functions (e.g., multiple ways to show the same status) 2. Function modules unrelated to number visualization (e.g., a built-in calculator) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow down the visualization). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data processing/visualization/interaction layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
